inlineContent.text: Please make sure the user’s audio quality is set to
before loading any tracks into AutomixIQ’s player.
The default configuration of AutomixIQ supports AAC-LC in MPEG-4 or ADTS containers.
On request it is possible to produce AutomixIQ with additional file format support.
Formats that can be enabled includes MP3, Opus, Vorbis, FLAC and ALAC decoders as well as Ogg and CAF containers.
For efficient mixing with streamed audio AutomixIQ requires that the audio is stored in a format that supports sample accurate real-time seek with only partial file download.
In practice, this means that formats that have a fine-grained seek table are preferred.
The only common compressed audio file format that fulfills the above requirements is AAC audio contained in the MPEG-4 file format and this kind of file usually has the ‘mp4’ or ‘m4a’ file extension.

There are two distinct families of audio formats. In one of them, notably represented by ‘mp3’ files, there is no separation between the packets of encoded audio and the file structure in which these are stored. In the other, visibly represented by e.g. Ogg/Vorbis, there is separation between the container (Ogg) and the format of the audio packets (Vorbis).
This means that some audio compression standards like AAC, depending on the container format, may or may not support the above requirements.
ADTS containers requires scanning the entire file to construct a seek table and is not a preferred format but is included to support mislabled AAC files.

abstract.text: Enable smooth transitions between tracks for a seamlessly beat-matched experience within your iOS music application.
